Contribute to the Community Mask Project, sponsored by the Mamaroneck Arts Council! Deadline has been extended til late August/early Sept. The Council is collecting masks to create a community art installation during this unprecedented time. To participate, paint or decorate a disposable surgical protective mask.(Sharpies or Acrylic Paints work best) Horizontal orientation. Pick one up at the Mamaroneck Library Information desk, 10-3pm. Supply is limited. Check the VOM Arts Council Facebook page for updates.

post_text: #SmartPlanning #Fall202Restart #PrioritizingHealthAndSafety Check out our head custodians sporting their new state-of-the-art electrostatic backpack sprayers, which will be a huge help with our stepped-up cleaning and disinfecting routines for #MUFSD school reopening and beyond. In lieu of spraying disinfectant by hand with a spray bottle, these machines (which are hard to come by and used by the NFL and airlines) electrostatically charge the solution as it comes out of the spray nozzle and will allow each of our 40 custodians district-wide the ability to evenly and quickly wrap the solution around edges of desks, door knobs, etc. and more effectively disinfect our buildings.

Hommocks and Mamaroneck High School students' original poems are featured in the Village of Mamaroneck Arts Council's newly-published anthology showcasing the creativity and imagination of young promising poets https://tinyurl.com/ycdtkgdp Although the traditional annual event at the Emelin Theater was cancelled due to the pandemic, we couldn't be prouder of our students, who were scheduled to read their work to a live audience of teachers, parents, families and friends.Thank you to the Arts Council for always hosting this event and recognizing our students.

To our students from the Poetry Live Co-Chairs: “Thank you for sharing your insights and expressing your imaginations.You have delivered creativity at just the right moment. This is not how any of us imagined Poetry Live! when you submitted your work a few months ago, yet here we are. Although we cannot celebrate you in person, we are honored to present this collection. Your words commemorate hope in the face of this historical time.”
